title: Community-Made Interactive Guides
description: 経験の浅い起業家には、自分のアイデアをビジネスにするための明確な道筋が与えられていません。

f6_assessments.q0: I believe people using Vrooli as a tool to submit their proposals will definitely submit higher quality proposals than not using Vrooli. Any tool that improves the quality of proposals is a must have for Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: Highly committed proposer with relevant and sufficient experience. Included lots of resources to familiarize anyone with the project's ins and outs. The budget allocation and plan is also sensible and straight to the point.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has a clear roadmap with  key performance indicators. A clear and effective solution is proposed to a long overdue problem. This proposal focuses on a solution and provides integrations like APIs, smart contracts etc. to extend its use cases to other projects. Which makes it able to scale and be resilient to future risks and challenges.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of automating minor steps in the process of a proposal is solid and makes it easier for proposers to get started. Making sure a proposer has all the necessary tools accessible to kick off a proposal without wondering if he forgot something or not will considerably enhance the quality of proposals. However, I do have some doubts about the creation of routines, how will you be able to get this going and make sure that quality prevails quantity in the early stages?
f6_assessments.q1: Looking at your GitHub and how active you are on it gives confidence in your expertise to do this. You clearly understand the objective of the challenge and your solution is simple yet effective. Another great indicator is that you were a participant in the Plutus pioneer program. The timeline on the proposal and GitHub match each other. The timeline is not farfetched and certainly doable from my experience. You're the first proposal I've come across with a reasonable hourly rate. The medium article is well written and explains everything in detail on what you plan to do with the website. Seeing that you already put this much work into it and how it's all well based I have confidence that this proposal is highly likely to be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability wise this is a valid proposal. Almost everything needed for further assessment and follow-ups is here. A clear roadmap, a decent budget,... One thing I would've like to see and what you can still do if the proposal is successfully funded is thinking about some metrics for the proposal. What are your thoughts about the success of this proposal? How will you state that the proposal is a success? What numbers can you give for it being successful? Think about active users, amount of routines, amount of feedback on routines, total reviews, engaged users,...

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge because there is currently no platform where people can learn, in depth, about how to bring their ideas to life. There is the telegram chat but this could be congested if too many questions are asked. The instructions on the catalyst website may be hard to interpret for those who do not learn well via reading so alternative pedagogy may have a great affect.
f6_assessments.q1: Matt appears to have a lot of experience within plutus and understands the language. His Github activity re enforces this experience. The links provided are relevant and support the idea of alternative pedagogy through visual alternatives and collaboration. His experience in web builind and knowledge f the cardano ecosystem gives me confidence that his proposal will be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: Matt provides a detailed timeline for the community to track and keep the proposer accountable. He also provides a detailed breakdown of associated costs involved including an hourly wage which is at a very moderate price for someone with his skills particularly considering demand for tech developers.

f6_assessments.q0: While the proposed Vrooli has potential as a tool, I dont see the specific connection to Catalyst or how it could help early-stage Catalyst entrepreneurs improve the quality of their proposals.  While i understand that community-made routines could facilitate this process, I believe there are other ways to educate the entrepreneurial community about the functioning of Catalyst that would be simpler and  more effective in the short and medium term.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's given credentials suggest that they could execute the proposal on the given timeline.  External links supporting those credentials would increase confidence.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal, timeline, and budget are detailed and their execution easily confirmed or dis-confirmed.

solution: コミュニティのメンバーが、提案者にビジネスプロセス全体を案内するルーチンを実行、提出、コメント、投票するためのサイトを構築します。
experience: Plutusのパイオニア。9年間のソフトウェア開発経験、コンピュータサイエンスの学位、フルスタックWeb開発のバックグラウンドを持つ。
